> > What am I worth? How can I be worth something when there are lives just=

tarting their careers as soldiers? They have their whole lives ahead of the=
m, and by Primus I'm prepared to give back what's been taken from them, THE=
IR FREEDOM!"

"All sentient being have worth young Tuscon." comes that whis=
per again
as Tuscon positioned himself near to the body of Optimus. "If you=
 do
not count your self as worth anything how can any one else see you as
w=
orthy of anything?"

Even as the voice spoke to Tuscon, Lord Elder chimed i=
n, unknowingly
agreeing with the whispered voice, "You know, you sound like=
 Rodimus.
He used to say things like that. He would get depressed when he
f=
ailed. Even if he won the battle, he would sometimes find things that

ssed."

"Yes Tuscon" the whispered voice continued. "Do not tie your sense =
of
self to your successes, but to your efforts to achieve that success.
Who=
 you are defines your value, not what you have you have achieved."

Another=
 whispered voice, also presumably from the Matrix inside
Optimus, "Tell me =
something Tuscon, we are not biological creatures
but technological, yet yo=
u are blind, why have you chosen to remain
so? could it be because you choo=
se to remember the pain of loss or
failure?"

Another voice whispered to Tu=
scon, this one sounding a little like

take that Rodimus has made. He
lost the energy matrix and himself in that l=
oss. He will need your

wer of the matrix
